Particularly with this film, I wanted to do more character-driven stuff," Reed told Comic-Con attendees last year. "
To make this movie about Carol Danvers, what her journey is, and how does she get there?
I think we've had plenty of big action scenes in our movies, but what makes it all work is the emotional connection."

I think what we found was something that's really important about Carol's origin story is it's not just about how she got her powers and became a superhero, but it's really about who she is, what motivates her, what drives her."

助詞 is pronounced “joshi” and it translates to “auxiliary word” or “helping verb.” In Japanese grammar, 助辞 are used to help express the tense, mood, and other grammatical functions in sentences. Some common examples of 助辞 include:

* ください (kudasai): makes the sentence polite, showing respect, similar to “please”
* し (shi): emphasizes or focuses attention on a certain part of the sentence, comparable to “indeed” or “in fact”
* かれ (kare): turns a sentence into a suggestion or proposition, similar to “shoulcn’t you?” or “how about…?”assistant
